intro: Chromolaena laevigata, commonly known as the Hawaiian tridax, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant has smooth, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. It produces yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are followed by small, oval-shaped fruits. Chromolaena laevigata is known for its rapid growth and has become an invasive species in several parts of the world.
